docs.lead_paragraph: Fearing current laws “are not protecting children,” states including New York are looking at making it harder for those younger than 18 to get married.

headline.main: States Make New Push to Curb Child Marriage
headline.print_headline: States Make New Push To Curb Child Marriage

docs.snippet: Fearing current laws “are not protecting children,” states including New York are looking at making it harder for those younger than 18 to get married.

docs.lead_paragraph: Dr. Raphael, a medical anthropologist and protégée of Margaret Mead, was among the first scientists to challenge milk formula manufacturers.

headline.main: Dana Raphael, Proponent of Breast-Feeding and Use of Doulas, Dies at 90

docs.abstract: Dana Raphael, anthropologist who championed breast milk over formula and ignited international movement to recruit doulas to assist mothers during and after childbirth, dies at age 90.
docs.snippet: Dr. Raphael, a medical anthropologist and protégée of Margaret Mead, was among the first scientists to challenge milk formula manufacturers.

docs.lead_paragraph: A job candidate’s comments on social media raise questions about whether to check accounts during the hiring process, and how to do so legally and ethically.

headline.main: The Résumé and References Check Out. How About Social Media?

docs.abstract: Rob Walker The Workologist column discusses whether employers should consider social media persona of job candidates.
docs.snippet: A job candidate’s comments on social media raise questions about whether to check accounts during the hiring process, and how to do so legally and ethically.

docs.lead_paragraph: A place to recover from the T.S.A. experience.
docs.abstract: Taffy Brodesser-Akner Letter of Recommendation column extols XpresSpa, airport oasis in midst of degrading air travel experience with power to restore some modicum of human dignity.
docs.snippet: A place to recover from the T.S.A. experience.

docs.lead_paragraph: Despite their staunch opposition to contraceptives, Philippine Roman Catholic bishops expressed their full support Saturday to Pope Francis' remarks suggesting artificial contraception can be used by women threatened by the Zika virus.

headline.main: Philippine Bishops Back Pope's Remarks on Zika Contraception
headline.print_headline: Philippine Bishops Back Pope's Remarks on Zika Contraception

docs.snippet: Despite their staunch opposition to contraceptives, Philippine Roman Catholic bishops expressed their full support Saturday to Pope Francis' remarks suggesting artificial contraception can be used by women threatened by the Zika virus.

docs.lead_paragraph: Spanish Olympic gold medalist Marina Alabau says she got Zika while training in Brazil in December, suffering painful symptoms in an experience that the wind surfer said won't stop her from competing in the Games in August.

headline.main: Spanish Gold Medalist Believes She Contracted Zika in Rio
headline.print_headline: Spanish Gold Medalist Believes She Contracted Zika in Rio

docs.snippet: Spanish Olympic gold medalist Marina Alabau says she got Zika while training in Brazil in December, suffering painful symptoms in an experience that the wind surfer said won't stop her from competing in the Games in August.

docs.lead_paragraph: The mosquito-borne Zika virus spreading through the Americas, linked to severe birth defects in Brazil, will not be controlled over the long-term unless governments improve poor living conditions in the region's sprawling slums, experts say.

headline.main: Zika Fuelled by Rapid Urbanization, Poor Conditions in Latam's Slums-Experts
headline.print_headline: Zika Fuelled by Rapid Urbanization, Poor Conditions in Latam's Slums-Experts

docs.snippet: The mosquito-borne Zika virus spreading through the Americas, linked to severe birth defects in Brazil, will not be controlled over the long-term unless governments improve poor living conditions in the region's sprawling slums, experts say.

docs.lead_paragraph: Child marriage wasn't an issue of note for Virginia state Sen. Jill Vogel until she heard the stories circulating in her district about a man in his early 50s marrying a girl in her mid-teens, warding off a police investigation of his relationship with her.

headline.main: Efforts Intensify to Curtail Child Marriage in the US
headline.print_headline: Efforts Intensify to Curtail Child Marriage in the US

docs.snippet: Child marriage wasn't an issue of note for Virginia state Sen. Jill Vogel until she heard the stories circulating in her district about a man in his early 50s marrying a girl in her mid-teens, warding off a police investigation of his relationship...

docs.lead_paragraph: Scientists suspect an outbreak of the Zika virus is behind a surge in a rare birth defect in Brazil. But how are they going to prove it?

headline.main: Can Scientists Prove Zika Virus Is Causing Birth Defects?
headline.print_headline: Can Scientists Prove Zika Virus Is Causing Birth Defects?

docs.snippet: Scientists suspect an outbreak of the Zika virus is behind a surge in a rare birth defect in Brazil. But how are they going to prove it?

docs.lead_paragraph: The pope’s remarks stirred up divisions in the leadership of the Roman Catholic Church in South America about whether birth control should be widely allowed.

headline.main: Francis Says Contraception Can Be Used to Slow Zika
headline.print_headline: Francis Says Contraception Can Be Used to Slow Zika

docs.abstract: Pope Francis condones use of contraceptives in predominantly Roman Catholic Latin American countries suffering from Zika virus; makes endorsement, which could shift governmental positions on practice, in hopes of lowering number of babies born with severe birth defects associated with virus.
docs.snippet: The pope’s remarks stirred up divisions in the leadership of the Roman Catholic Church in South America about whether birth control should be widely allowed.

byline.contributor: Simon Romero reported from São Paulo, and Jim Yardley from aboard Pope Francis’ plane. Reporting was contributed by Jonathan Gilbert from Buenos Aires; Vinod Sreeharsha from Rio de Janeiro; Susan Abad from Bogotá, Colombia; Azam Ahmed from Mexico City; and Gene Palumbo from San Salvador.
byline.original: By SIMON ROMERO and JIM YARDLEY
